AD_Parents.synopsis: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.

Guard3.synopsis: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.

AD_ParentsLeaving.synopsis: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.

Guard2.synopsis: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.

Protester1.synopsis: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.

ParentsWithKid.synopsis: The player has saved Arabella from the snake court. She is back with her parents and they are grateful to the player. This should be a fun and loving scene between the three.

AD_ParentsScene.synopsis: (script comment: it is repeated, but I don't want it to be culled out)This occurs as the player approaches the scene. Locke and Marrick are arguing with two druid guards - trying to get in. Their daughter is inside but they are being denied entrance.Tensions are high and voices are raised. This is a tense exchange.

SoloParentB.synopsis: Marricko's dialog after her kid is back (and she thanked and rewarded the player) or after learning that her kid is dead.

SoloParentA.synopsis: This is for the edgecase in which one of the parents has died. In this case - Locke, the husband survives. In the first scenarion he rewards and thanks the player for saving his daughter's life - lamenting briefly on their lives without Arabella's mother.In the second, he learns that Arabella has died. He is overcome with grief and rage at losing both his wife and daughter.

Protester3.synopsis: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.synopsis: This is the edgecase in which the player takes Arabella's corpse and dumps it in front of her parents. They are hysterical with grief.

AD_Protesters.synopsis: Three tieflings voice their anger at how they're being treated by the druids of the grove. They've been barred from entry into an innermost section while the fdruids conduct a ritual that will ultimately seal off the grove.

AD_ParentsWithKid.synopsis: Through the player's intervention Arabella is alive and has been reuinted with her parents. They are trying to remain stern with her but are indredibly grateful to have her back.

individual_metadata.synopsis: Three druids guard the entrance to the inner part of their sanctuary, blocking any outsiders. They're on edge, having recently driven back some outraged tiefling refugees who know the druids hold one of their children captive. One of the druids transformed into a bear during this confrontation, causing the tieflings to back down. Now we try to gain passage while tempers are still running hot.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Travel to the Sacred Pond area of the grove and interact with the guards manning the steps once the tieflings have been repelled.

Protester2.synopsis: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.

Guard1.synopsis: Jeorna, one of the druid grove guards, speaks to the player after they've been allowed entry. She's curt and not greatly pleased that we're allowed inside.

ParentsScene.synopsis: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.
ParentsScene.how_to_trigger: - goto 250.533; 23.756; 552.954- Walk down the stairs toward the Druid Grove

Parents.synopsis: Locke and Marrick are parents who are scared for their daughter Arabella. Taken by the druids, Arabella is appearing in court on accusations of thievery. Her parents have no doubt that she is guilty but they are terrified for her and trying to get to her.Marrick hides his concern throughout with anger and threats of violence. It is easier to deal with fury then it is to temper fear. Locke is more level-headed but no less close to violence. Marrick and Locke are both at the entrance to the inner grove and the sacred pool and have just been denied entry.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Several sessions clearly follow one another in cause–effect relationships. For example, in the parental branch the tense approach scene (AD_ParentsScene) logically comes before the parents’ retreat (AD_ParentsLeaving) when they have been threatened by the guards. In the branch where the daughter dies, the shock and grief of the parents (AD_Parents) must come before the even more dramatic reaction when the player dumps Arabella’s corpse before them (AD_ParentsSeeCorpse). Conversely, when the daughter is saved and reunited with her parents, the reunion (ParentsWithKid) happens first and then a follow‐up dialogue from one of the surviving parents (SoloParentB) takes place. In addition, the “empty key” session – which describes the trio of druids standing guard outside the inner sanctum – is meant to set up the passage that then leads to Guard1 speaking after entry is allowed. Finally, some sessions represent mutually exclusive narrative branches: if the daughter is dead then AD_Parents is used and AD_ParentsWithKid (or ParentsWithKid) cannot be triggered; likewise, the intimate SoloParentA (in the edgecase where one parent has died) should not occur if the reunion path leading to SoloParentB is taken. Similarly, multiple protester sessions exist – Protester1, Protester2, and Protester3 – which echo similar sentiments, and their grouped alternative (AD_Protesters) is logically exclusive with any individual protester dialogue being chosen.

AD_Parents_0.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents_0.context: NodeContext: Crying - grieving. Your daughter is dead

AD_Parents_12.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents_12.context: NodeContext: Holding back tears to comfort your husband - trying to be strong

AD_Parents_1.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents_1.text: I could take one of the guards. Maybe two.

AD_Parents_2.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents_2.text: What about the bear? I'd like to keep our guts on the inside.

AD_Parents_3.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents_3.text: I bet she's giving them hell. She's not our kid for nothing.

AD_Parents_8.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents_8.text: I could try grease some palms - ease things over.

AD_Parents_9.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents_9.text: Because that went so well last time.

AD_Parents_10.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents_10.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents_10.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents_5.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents_5.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents_5.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents_6.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents_6.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

AD_Parents_11.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents_11.text: I'll kill her - I'll kill the snake.

Guard3_0.speaker: Mino
Guard3_0.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3_0.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard3_1.speaker: Mino
Guard3_1.text: See to your business here quickly - then leave.
Guard3_1.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard3_2.speaker: Mino
Guard3_2.text: Remember, outsider - you are tolerated more than you are welcome.
Guard3_2.context: NodeContext: The atmosphere in the grove is slightly less tense when this line is spoken, but it's not exactly friendly either.

Guard3_3.speaker: Mino
Guard3_3.text: The Rite of Thorns has ceased; it seems you will be allowed to stay - but behave.
Guard3_3.context: NodeContext: The atmosphere in the grove is slightly less tense when this line is spoken, but it's not exactly friendly either.

AD_ParentsLeaving_1.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving_1.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving_0.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving_0.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

Guard2_0.speaker: Maggran
Guard2_0.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

Guard2_1.speaker: Maggran
Guard2_1.text: The rite has been stopped - for now. But I'm still watching you.
Guard2_1.context: NodeContext: In human form. A terse warning

Guard2_2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2_2.text: You're lucky I'm not in my bear form. Back off.
Guard2_2.context: NodeContext: Human form. He's done talking and wants rid of the player

Guard2_3.speaker: Maggran
Guard2_3.text: Do not squander our generosity - respect the grove.
Guard2_3.context: NodeContext: In human form. A terse warning

Protester1_0.speaker: Rechel
Protester1_0.text: Lives are at stake, and the cowards only care about their bloody rituals!
Protester1_0.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

Protester1_1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1_1.text: Those druids are going to get us killed - nothing sacred about this lot!
Protester1_1.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

Protester1_2.speaker: Rechel
Protester1_2.text: Now they're done messing about with rituals, maybe them lot can make themselves useful.
Protester1_2.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

ParentsWithKid_8.speaker: Komira
ParentsWithKid_8.text: You ever scare me like that again, and I'll feed you to a gnoll.
ParentsWithKid_8.context: NodeContext: Speaking to your daughter - you're trying to discipline her but you're just relieved she's alive.

ParentsWithKid_17.speaker: Locke
ParentsWithKid_17.text: You saved our little girl and stopped the ritual. Thank you - we are in your debt.
ParentsWithKid_17.context: InternalNodeContext: If the player resolves both the Snake Court Scene + the Denouncing Kagha scene before going back to the parentsNodeContext: Smile and love in your voice

ParentsWithKid_0.speaker: Locke
ParentsWithKid_0.text: Our little hellion told us what happened. Thank you - don't know what we'd do without her.
ParentsWithKid_0.context: NodeContext: Smile and love in your voice

ParentsWithKid_1.speaker: Komira
ParentsWithKid_1.text: It's not much, but here. Never thought I'd call a drow 'friend' but know this - if you call, we'll come running. No matter what.
ParentsWithKid_1.context: NodeContext: Love and steel in your voice - you've move the earth for the player

ParentsWithKid_4.speaker: Player
ParentsWithKid_4.text: I hope we'll meet again under better circumstances.

ParentsWithKid_12.speaker: Komira
ParentsWithKid_12.text: Well it's all we got. Arabella?
ParentsWithKid_12.context: NodeContext: Said with a shrug - turning to daughter

ParentsWithKid_2.speaker: Player
ParentsWithKid_2.text: I saved your daughter - got anything more than a thanks for me?

ParentsWithKid_15.speaker: Komira
ParentsWithKid_15.text: I did - but I was robbed. You wouldn't know anything about that, would you?

ParentsWithKid_11.speaker: Locke
ParentsWithKid_11.text: Marri. All we can offer is our thanks. Arabella?
ParentsWithKid_11.context: NodeContext: Embarassed 'Marri'. Trying to tell your wife to stop. Turning to Arabella to offer thanks.

ParentsWithKid_13.speaker: Player
ParentsWithKid_13.text: This could've ended badly - keep her in line from now on.

ParentsWithKid_9.speaker: Locke
ParentsWithKid_9.text: The Nine Hells will sooner freeze over. But we'll try.
ParentsWithKid_9.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile and love in your voice

ParentsWithKid_16.speaker: Player
ParentsWithKid_16.text: No more light-fingered antics - right, Arabella?

ParentsWithKid_3.speaker: Arabella
ParentsWithKid_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mother looks at her sternlyNodeContext: Said with a shrug - then catch sight of your mother looking at your sternly

ParentsWithKid_14.speaker: Komira
ParentsWithKid_14.text: It's not much, but here. Know that if you call, we'll come running. No matter what.
ParentsWithKid_14.context: NodeContext: Love and steel in your voice - you've move the earth for the player

AD_ParentsScene_0.speaker: Jeorna
AD_ParentsScene_0.text: Step back - you sully our holy ground!

SoloParentB_0.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_0.text: I'm not letting Bells out of my sight. Should the druids try anything again... well, Kelemvor is going to be busy.
SoloParentB_0.context: NodeContext: Sincere and grateful - note of steel in your voice. No one is messing with your daughter again.

SoloParentB_1.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_1.text: Because of you, we can leave on our own terms. That'll make all the difference on the road ahead.

SoloParentB_3.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_3.text: The ritual is stopped. That's all Arabella wanted. That's what she tried so hard to do. Please - leave me.

SoloParentB_4.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_4.context: NodeContext: Crying - grieving. Hysterical. Furious.  Covering face.

SoloParentB_5.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_5.text: Because of you, I got my little girl back. That's not something I'll forget.

SoloParentB_6.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_6.text: Arabella is back and the druids have stopped their warbling. The day just got a lot brighter - thanks to you.

SoloParentB_8.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_8.text: You bastard - you lied to me. You said Arabella was all right!
SoloParentB_8.context: NodeContext: Rage-filled grief. Player lied and said your daughter was alive. She was actually dead. Stepping towards player.

SoloParentB_2.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_2.text: Everyone else is licking your boots but some advice? Stay the hells away from me - unless you fancy meeting Kelemvor.

SoloParentB_11.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_11.text: And then you kill that snake Kagha? I don't know whose side you're on, but stay the hells away from me.

SoloParentB_9.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_9.text: You have any sense? You and that snake Kagha will sleep with one eye open.

SoloParentB_10.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_10.context: NodeContext: Crying - grieving. Hysterical. Furious. Covering face.

SoloParentB_12.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_12.context: NodeContext: Crying - grieving. Hysterical. Furious.  Covering face.

SoloParentB_13.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_13.text: My little girl is dead. You were there! Why didn't you stop it?

SoloParentB_14.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB_14.text: You bastard. Get away! GET AWAY FROM ME!

SoloParentA_0.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA_0.text: All Arabella wanted to do is help. But you and half the grove stood by and let her die - alone.

SoloParentA_4.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA_4.text: Get out of my sight. For your own good.

SoloParentA_1.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA_1.text: The road to Baldur's Gate looks a little less daunting now that we're all back together.

SoloParentA_6.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA_6.text: Arabella has behaved herself - so far. A miracle in itself. Thank you again.

SoloParentA_7.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA_7.text: Everyone is so excited about leaving now. But without Arabella - it doesn't matter. None of it matters.

SoloParentA_9.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA_9.text: We can prepare for the journey to Baldur's Gate in peace now.

SoloParentA_10.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA_10.text: I am not a violent man. But lying to us about Arabella?

SoloParentA_11.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA_11.text: You got our little girl home safe, and I can rest easy knowing we won't be turned out on our backsides. I can't say thanks enough.

Protester3_0.speaker: Xeph
Protester3_0.text: This place ain't so special. Why were the druids so protective of it?
Protester3_0.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

Protester3_2.speaker: Xeph
Protester3_2.text: We could help each other - fight the goblins together. Instead these fools are trying to chase us away!
Protester3_2.context: NodeContext: Angry. Starts talking to the player about how the druids mistreat the tielfings.

Protester3_3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3_3.text: Look at them, trying to pretend we don't exist. Hey, you lot - I'm going nowhere!
Protester3_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: 2nd sentence directed at druid guards, not playerNodeContext: Angry. Starts talking to the player about how the druids mistreat the tielfings. Shouts the second sentence at the druids, who are a short distance away.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse_3.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse_3.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse_1.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse_1.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse_2.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse_2.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_Protesters_0.speaker: Rechel
AD_Protesters_0.text: Do all the damn rituals you want - we're not leaving 'til it's safe!
AD_Protesters_0.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_Protesters_3.speaker: Amek
AD_Protesters_3.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_Protesters_4.speaker: Xeph
AD_Protesters_4.text: You lot're the same as those bloody goblins!
AD_Protesters_4.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_Protesters_5.speaker: Xeph
AD_Protesters_5.text: Keep this up an' you'll have blood on your hands!
AD_Protesters_5.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_Protesters_6.speaker: Rechel
AD_Protesters_6.text: Bloody druids. Making more hassle for us over nothing.
AD_Protesters_6.context: NodeContext: The tension's been reduced somewhat, but anger still simmers

AD_Protesters_1.speaker: Amek
AD_Protesters_1.text: At least they've calmed down now.
AD_Protesters_1.context: NodeContext: The tension's been reduced somewhat, but anger still simmers

AD_Protesters_7.speaker: Amek
AD_Protesters_7.text: Your master let us in here. We're your guests!
AD_Protesters_7.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_Protesters_8.speaker: Rechel
AD_Protesters_8.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting in reference to some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_Protesters_9.speaker: Xeph
AD_Protesters_9.text: Doesn't change much. We're still trapped.
AD_Protesters_9.context: NodeContext: The tension's been reduced somewhat, but anger still simmers

AD_Protesters_11.speaker: Rechel
AD_Protesters_11.text: A little more room to hide from goblins, at least.
AD_Protesters_11.context: NodeContext: The tension's been reduced somewhat, but anger still simmers

AD_Protesters_10.speaker: Amek
AD_Protesters_10.text: Don't see what's so special about this part. Just more Grove.
AD_Protesters_10.context: NodeContext: The tension's been reduced somewhat, but anger still simmers

AD_Protesters_2.speaker: Xeph
AD_Protesters_2.text: Probably hoarding supplies for themselves. Seems like something they'd do.
AD_Protesters_2.context: NodeContext: The tension's been reduced somewhat, but anger still simmers

AD_ParentsWithKid_2.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsWithKid_2.text: Stealing the idol - what were you thinking?

AD_ParentsWithKid_10.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsWithKid_10.text: You nearly died, do you hear me? What would your mother and I have done?

AD_ParentsWithKid_5.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsWithKid_5.text: Bells, it's our job to get us out of here safely - not yours.

AD_ParentsWithKid_6.speaker: Arabella
AD_ParentsWithKid_6.text: It's my job too. The druids don't care about us. No one does.

AD_ParentsWithKid_9.speaker: Arabella
AD_ParentsWithKid_9.text: We have to look after ourselves. That's what Mol says.

AD_ParentsWithKid_4.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsWithKid_4.text: That girl. I don't care what Mol says. That was stupid and reckless.

AD_ParentsWithKid_1.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsWithKid_1.text: Your mother was a heartbeat away from fighting a bear.

AD_ParentsWithKid_3.speaker: Arabella
AD_ParentsWithKid_3.text: Isn't that how mum usually is?

12.speaker: Jeorna
12.context: InternalNodeContext: Player is in the trigger S_DEN_PondTrespassBox

26.speaker: Maggran
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Threatening roar + aggressive stance from the bear/druid. But he doesn't attack.

5.speaker: Jeorna
5.text: Calm, Maggran. Give them a chance.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druid guard raises a hand to her bear colleague, stilling him.NodeContext: She's addressing the bear, but 'give him/her a chance' is more for the player's benefit.

20.speaker: Jeorna
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jeorna (druid1) turns to address the player.NodeContext: Entry not up for discussion.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Why? What's so special down here?

16.speaker: Jeorna
16.text: It's forbidden to outsiders - Kagha's orders.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear-druid glowers menacingly when druid says 'see what happens'

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I'm not looking for trouble. Can't you just let me by?

24.speaker: Jeorna
24.text: No. And you'll find trouble all the same, unless you get out of my sight.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I am a druid, same as yourself. Allow me to pass and pay my respects. Please.

6.speaker: Jeorna
6.text: Druid or not, you're still an outsider to this place. Entry is forbidden.

22.speaker: Maggran
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear roars and looms ferociously.

14.speaker: Jeorna
14.text: Stop! Another step and Maggran will tear you open like a sack of grain.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards the bear on 'and Maggran'.NodeContext: Anger starting to boil over. Between the refugees and us, she's had enough of outsiders and their demands, Stop is addressed to the player - they're pushing their luck and Jeorna's bear-druid colleague is ready to rip them apart.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: If it weren't for me, you'd be overrun by goblins by now. I'll go where I please.

13.speaker: Jeorna
13.text: Keep back. Force my hand, and I'll show you its claws.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear-druid glowers menacingly when druid says 'show you its claws'.NodeContext: Final warning.

0.speaker: Mino
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mino  interjects, approaching Jeorna's side.

7.speaker: Jeorna
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mino whispers something inaudible to Jeorna, who glances at you with realisation of something.

29.speaker: Jeorna
29.text: But a word of warning. One wrong move and every single animal here will tear you apart.
29.context: NodeContext: This is an extra warning spoken to drow players in particular - Jeorna (and many others) consider them a threat.

10.speaker: Jeorna
10.text: You - apparently Kagha wants to see you. Go ahead.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jeorna's attention is fully with the player again. She waves them through the checkpoint.NodeContext: Sudden change of tone. She bruskly allows the player to pass.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: No need for threats. Why can't I move around freely here?

9.speaker: Maggran
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Extra-hostile. Combat breaks out immediately after this node.NodeContext: SFX only

28.speaker: Jeorna
28.text: You're testing my patience. Leave, unless you want to see my other face.

Protester2_0.speaker: Amek
Protester2_0.text: Looks like the druids have eased off some. Small mercies.
Protester2_0.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

Protester2_1.speaker: Amek
Protester2_1.text: Heartless bastards. They deserve to have the goblins burn 'em out.
Protester2_1.context: NodeContext: Angry. Speaking to the player about the druids and how they're treating the tiefling refugees

Protester2_2.speaker: Amek
Protester2_2.text: Those dirt-kissers would let us die for the sake of their bloody grove!
Protester2_2.context: NodeContext: Angry. Speaking to the player about the druids and how they're treating the tiefling refugees

Guard1_0.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1_0.text: Your companion vouched for you, but you're being watched. Respect our grove.
Guard1_0.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player's been granted entry but the guard isn't too welcoming.

Guard1_2.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1_2.text: We've ceased our ritual, but that's not an invitation for you to do as you please. Be respectful of this place.
Guard1_2.context: NodeContext: A little less tense than before, but still not inclined to chat to the player.

Guard1_3.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1_3.text: Show some dignity and leave. You've burdened this place with your troubles long enough.
Guard1_3.context: NodeContext: Resentful. Possibly speaking to a fellow druid, in which case she refers to the outsiders in third person.

Guard1_4.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1_4.text: On your way, outsider. You've taken up enough of my time.
Guard1_4.context: NodeContext: A little less tense than before, but still not inclined to chat to the player.

Guard1_5.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1_5.text: Your welcome can easily be withdrawn, outsider. Respect our grove, or face our claws.
Guard1_5.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player's been granted entry but the guard isn't too welcoming. Extra line directed towards tieflings.

ParentsScene_0.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene_0.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene_1.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene_1.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene_2.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene_2.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene_4.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

ParentsScene_3.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene_3.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

Parents_13.speaker: Locke
Parents_13.text: The road to Baldur's Gate looks a little less daunting now that we're all back together.
Parents_13.context: NodeContext: Sincere and filled with love as you think of your family. You feel you can take on the world with them by your side.

Parents_29.speaker: Komira
Parents_29.text: We need to get Arabella out. Now.
Parents_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to husbandNodeContext: Your daughter is trapped inside with a bunch of druids who hate her. You're scared for her and instead of crying - you're angry. Snapping at your husband.

Parents_47.speaker: Locke
Parents_47.text: You heard the guards - they're waiting on Kagha to give word.
Parents_47.context: NodeContext: You know your wife is angry because she's scared for your daughter. Trying to calm the situation.

Parents_12.speaker: Komira
Parents_12.text: I'd sooner trek through the Nine Hells than trust that snake. Argh.
Parents_12.context: NodeContext: Utter hatred in your voice at the mention of 'that snake'. Kagha. The woman who took your daughter.

Parents_57.speaker: Player
Parents_57.text: I saw what happened. Why are the druids holding your daughter?

Parents_96.speaker: Locke
Parents_96.text: Arabella tried to steal their idol. Druids lost their damn minds about it - they need it for their precious ritual.
Parents_96.context: NodeContext: Sighing in frustration - you don't agree with your daughter did but the druids have MASSIVELY blown it out of proportion. Arabella was just trying to help.

Parents_68.speaker: Locke
Parents_68.text: It's our daughter. Kagha locked her up for stealing the idol - they need it for their precious ritual.
Parents_68.context: NodeContext: Sighing in frustration - you don't agree with your daughter did but the druids have MASSIVELY blown it out of proportion. Arabella was just trying to help.

Parents_92.speaker: Komira
Parents_92.text: It's all my fault. I told her I wished the wretched thing would just disappear - or better yet, explode.
Parents_92.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself - even though it's not your fault. Very critical.

Parents_40.speaker: Locke
Parents_40.text: Now Arabella is being judged by a bunch of druids who hate us. That's not right.
Parents_40.context: NodeContext: You're terrified for you daughter. She

Parents_82.speaker: Lae'zel
Parents_82.text: She was caught? Foolish child - let them judge her.

Parents_69.speaker: Shadowheart
Parents_69.text: Sounds like she made the fatal mistake of getting caught. We shouldn't get involved.

Parents_87.speaker: Karlach
Parents_87.text: Poor thing must be terrified. Who do they think they are, keeping her away from her folks?

Parents_4.speaker: Astarion
Parents_4.text: Breaking into druid chambers to steal a sacred relic? Oh, she sounds like fun.

Parents_21.speaker: Player
Parents_21.text: She's just a child - the druids are overreacting. I'll talk to them.

Parents_43.speaker: Locke
Parents_43.text: Thank you. They won't give us the time of day.

Parents_64.speaker: Komira
Parents_64.text: Hurry. I'm at the end of my tether as is - can't take this waiting.
Parents_64.context: NodeContext: You're getting annoyed because it's easier than what you really feel - terrified for your daughter.

Parents_76.speaker: Player
Parents_76.text: You've got your work cut out for you.

Parents_73.speaker: Locke
Parents_73.text: We'll figure something out. We always do.
Parents_73.context: NodeContext: Firm and determined - you'll save your family. You always do.

Parents_23.speaker: Komira
Parents_23.text: Speaking of - we don't have time to gabber. You'd best move on.
Parents_23.context: NodeContext: Dismissive tone - gesturing for the player to leave.

Parents_83.speaker: Player
Parents_83.text: Like you said - it's your fault. You should've tried parenting her.

Parents_27.speaker: Komira
Parents_27.text: And you should bugger off. Now.
Parents_27.context: NodeContext: No nonsense tone - frustrated that the player has wasted your time.

Parents_2.speaker: Player
Parents_2.text: Thieves deserve to be punished. It's as simple as that.

Parents_58.speaker: Komira
Parents_58.context: NodeContext: Rolling your eyes as you wave dismissively at the player. Someone else who thinks tieflings are thieves.

Parents_35.speaker: Wyll
Parents_35.text: Horrifying. We should check on the girl.

Parents_81.speaker: Gale
Parents_81.text: This grove is like a cauldron about to boil over. I say we check in on the child - make sure she comes to no harm.

Parents_90.speaker: Player
Parents_90.text: You need to be careful. That bear would've torn you to shreds.

Parents_59.speaker: Komira
Parents_59.text: I don't give a mrag about me. It's my daughter I'm worried about.
Parents_59.context: NodeContext: Sharp tongued and passionate - you'd cut your own throat if it meant keeping yoru daughter safe,

Parents_11.speaker: Player
Parents_11.text: Snake? You must really dislike Kagha.

Parents_97.speaker: Komira
Parents_97.text: Damn right I do. She locked up our daughter.
Parents_97.context: NodeContext: Venom in your voice at the mention of Kagha - you HATE her.

Parents_45.speaker: Player
Parents_45.text: Snake? You must really dislike this Kagha.

Parents_34.speaker: Komira
Parents_34.text: How long is Kagha gonna take?
Parents_34.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - turning and looking around as if you'll see your daughter any moment. Something feels off, but you can't put your finger on it. (it transpires that the player lied - your daughter won't be released by Kagha, as Kagha murdered her.)

Parents_25.speaker: Locke
Parents_25.text: She'll release Arabella soon. I'm sure.
Parents_25.context: NodeContext: You see your wife's temper rising and you're trying to calm the situation. You know she's just worried for your daughter.

Parents_36.speaker: Komira
Parents_36.text: I'll rush the guards. You sprint past.
Parents_36.context: NodeContext: Thinking of ways to get to your little girl - who is trapped inside. You don't care what happens to you - you just want to make sure your daughter is safe.

Parents_65.speaker: Locke
Parents_65.text: I won't risk you too, love. We'll find another way.
Parents_65.context: NodeContext: You see the cogs turning in your wife's mind - you know she'll throw her life away to get to Arabella. You're trying to make sure both your wife and daughter survive the day.

Parents_37.speaker: Komira
Parents_37.text: Unless you have news of Arabella I don't want to hear it.
Parents_37.context: NodeContext: You still don't know if your daughter is okay. Tense and irritated - snapping a little though you don't mean to. You're just worried.

Parents_10.speaker: Player
Parents_10.text: She was bitten by a snake. It happened quickly. She felt no pain.

Parents_61.speaker: Komira
Parents_61.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter was bitten by a snake - you don't follow. Mainly shocked and confused.

Parents_26.speaker: Locke
Parents_26.context: NodeContext: Stepping forward - asking for clairifcation. Scared at what the player will say - could you daughter be hurt? sick? what happened to her?

Parents_7.speaker: Locke
Parents_7.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter is dead. You're shell shocked - barely taking in the world around you.

Parents_3.speaker: Player
Parents_3.text: Arabella is gone. I'm sorry for your loss.

Parents_52.speaker: Komira
Parents_52.text: Don't be ridiculous. What are you on about?
Parents_52.context: NodeContext: You've heard the words - your daughter is dead, but you don't believe. Snapping at the player - surely this is all a misunderstanding?

Parents_39.speaker: Player
Parents_39.text: It was an accident. I wish it weren't true.

Parents_31.speaker: Komira
Parents_31.text: No. You're not saying? You're wrong. You're wrong. Bells...
Parents_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: |collapses to the ground, crying alongside her husband|NodeContext: you've just learned you child is dead - hysterical grieving

Parents_70.speaker: Player
Parents_70.text: Believe me or don't. It won't bring your daughter back.

Parents_8.speaker: Komira
Parents_8.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset - you thought the player just said Arabella wasn't all right, but surely that can't be true. Turning to your husband, your rock.

Parents_46.speaker: Locke
Parents_46.context: NodeContext: Looking to the player - trying to be firm and strong even as you get upset yourself.

Parents_24.speaker: Komira
Parents_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: collapses to the ground, crying alongside her husband|NodeContext: you've just learned you child is dead - hysterical grieving as you collapse - calling out for your husband.

Parents_30.speaker: Player
Parents_30.text: I've involved myself too much already. No more.

Parents_9.speaker: Komira
Parents_9.context: NodeContext: Utterly furious - you feel the player has been yanking your chain and you're done with it. Snapping at them.

Parents_19.speaker: Komira
Parents_19.text: Are you having a laugh? Is this funny to you?
Parents_19.context: NodeContext: Aggresive - getting up in the player's face. The player has been yanking your chain and you're done with it.

Parents_54.speaker: Locke
Parents_54.text: Enough. No point mislaying our trust. We'll get Bells back on our own.
Parents_54.context: NodeContext: To your wife - knowing she's about to throw a punch and trying to calm the situation

Parents_95.speaker: Komira
Parents_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: As she walks awayNodeContext: Angrily mutter to yourself

Parents_53.speaker: Locke
Parents_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to playerNodeContext: Dry and sarcastic

Parents_78.speaker: Player
Parents_78.text: Nothing - bad joke. Arabella's fine. Kagha will release her soon.

Parents_5.speaker: Player
Parents_5.text: Tyr will not let this injustice go unpunished.

Parents_60.speaker: Komira
Parents_60.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset - you thought the player just said Arabella wasn't all right, but surely that can't be true. Turning to your husband, your rock.

Parents_48.speaker: Player
Parents_48.text: She is cradled in the Moonmaiden's embrace now.

Parents_94.speaker: Player
Parents_94.text: Ilmater ensured she was in no pain. She left this world in peace.

Parents_44.speaker: Player
Parents_44.text: Kelemvor has taken her by the hand and guided her to the afterlife. She is safe now.

Parents_62.speaker: Player
Parents_62.text: That trial was a farce. Moradin will ensure her death does not go unpunished.

Parents_88.speaker: Player
Parents_88.text: I will pray to Glittergold. He will watch over her - and her soul will be filled with peace and laughter.

Parents_41.speaker: Player
Parents_41.text: Little is more important than family. Yondalla will watch over your daughter - I promise.

Parents_32.speaker: Player
Parents_32.text: Truth is better than ignorance - no matter how dark it may be. Your child is gone.

Parents_49.speaker: Player
Parents_49.text: Under Helm's gaze I saw it. I don't believe Kagha meant to kill the child.

Parents_85.speaker: Locke
Parents_85.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset - you thought the player just said Arabella wasn't all right, but surely that can't be true. Turning to your husband, your rock.

Parents_67.speaker: Player
Parents_67.text: Do not weep for your loss - wrest control of this place from the druids. Kill them for what they have done.

Parents_28.speaker: Locke
Parents_28.text: Loss? What are you on about?
Parents_28.context: NodeContext: Player has just said they are sorry for your loss, but what are they talking about? Surely it's not your daughter. She's fine - she has to be!

Parents_15.speaker: Player
Parents_15.text: Your daughter should have slain the snake - instead she fell to its venom.

Parents_79.speaker: Player
Parents_79.text: This is none of my concern.

Parents_1.speaker: Player
Parents_1.text: Kagha will release her soon, just hold on.

Parents_63.speaker: Komira
Parents_63.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter will be released 'soon'. Snapping and frustrated. You need to see here and you're terrified for her.

Parents_74.speaker: Locke
Parents_74.text: Hang on, love. This'll be over soon enough - we just gotta wait a bit longer.
Parents_74.context: NodeContext: You see your wife's temper rising and you're trying to calm the situation. You know she's just worried for your daughter.

Parents_71.speaker: Locke
Parents_71.text: Thank you. Sincerely. I don't know what we'd do without our little girl.
Parents_71.context: NodeContext: Turning to the player - love and gratitude in your voice.

Parents_56.speaker: Player
Parents_56.text: Kagha killed your daughter. She called her a 'parasite' and a 'threat'.

Parents_50.speaker: Locke
Parents_50.context: NodeContext: Player has just brutally said that your daughter was called a parasite right before she was murdered. You're entire world collapses. You can't even see the player in front of you - everything centres around one thing. Your child is dead.

Parents_20.speaker: Komira
Parents_20.context: NodeContext: Screaming in near incomprehensible words. Hysterical grieving as you turn to your husband

Parents_16.speaker: Komira
Parents_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: collapses to the ground, crying alongside her husband|NodeContext: Screaming in near incomprehensible words. Hysterical grieving as you turn to your husband

Parents_38.speaker: Komira
Parents_38.context: NodeContext: Near screaming in grief - your daughter is dead and the player is trying to speak to you.

Parents_51.speaker: Locke
Parents_51.text: Arabella has behaved herself - so far. A miracle in itself. Thank you again.
Parents_51.context: NodeContext: Sincere and filled with love as you think of your family. You feel you can take on the world with them by your side.

Parents_93.speaker: Komira
Parents_93.text: Unless you have news of Arabella I don't want to hear it.
Parents_93.context: NodeContext: You still don't know if your daughter is okay. Tense and irritated - snapping a little though you don't mean to. You're just worried.

Parents_91.speaker: Locke
Parents_91.text: Please - she's been in there too long. It's not safe.
Parents_91.context: NodeContext: Trying not to beg but you're definitely pleading. Your little girl is all alone and you're terrified for her.
